## Development Checklist

<!-- Check all items that apply to your PR -->

- [ ] Code follows the project's style standards
- [ ] I performed a self-review of my own code
- [ ] I commented code in hard-to-understand sections
- [ ] I made corresponding changes to documentation
- [ ] My changes generate no new warnings
- [ ] I added tests that prove my fix is effective or my feature works
- [ ] New and existing unit tests pass locally with my changes
- [ ] Build passes locally (`pnpm run build`)
- [ ] Commits follow the Conventional Commits standard

## Commits Checklist

<!-- Verify that your commits follow best practices -->

- [ ] Commits follow the format: `type(scope): subject`
- [ ] Valid types used: feat, fix, docs, style, refactor, perf, test, build, ci, chore
- [ ] Subject uses imperative mood (add, not added or adds)
- [ ] Subject in lowercase
- [ ] Small and focused commits (one commit = one logical change)
